Reviews.Title: “Looking for the perfect Istanbul lodging? This is it!”
Reviews.Author: Becky C
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I just spent a week in Istanbul at the Alzer Hotel. it is located right on the Hippodrome, and our night view was the Blue Mosque. Breathtaking! Tram lines are convenient, but it is the friendly, helpful staff that makes this site outstanding. Whether it is dinner, a day trip, shuttles to and from the airport, amenities, or a thousand other needs, they are there to make sure your stay is wonderful. I would never stay anywhere else. The Alzer is our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel *****”
Reviews.Author: 1Ash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my child for 5 days, during my stay I was very pleased with the friendly staff. I also enjoyed the breakfast due to the fantastic scenery of the blue mosque and the surrounding area. I was also pleased with the management who made my child feel very welcome and comfortable. The transport facilities were very close to the hotel which was ideal for sightseeing. The rooms were clean and spacious. Overall I was very pleased with all aspects of the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: devonk8
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay! Lovely individual rooms, very clean, fantastic roof terrace breakfast and amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: tourist2488
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Alzer hotel (room 13) for the last 11 nights. It was quite a long stay but we loved Istanbul so much we didn't want to leave! The hotel is in a great location, the museum is right next door, with sultan ahmet (blue mosque) LITERALLY across the road. the haya sophia is also across the road and topaci palace and grand bazaar are walking distance. Towards the end of our trip, we were really low on cash so we walked EVERYWHERE (even to galata tower). The hotel is literally in the heart of sultan ahmet. Great views from the terrace and breakfast was lovely too. The staff were so friendly and had heaps of great tips about where to go and what to see and do!! It was wonderful coming back to our room at the end of an exhausting day, it really felt like home. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “amazing view”
Reviews.Author: LenkaT17
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just opposite to Blue Mosque, I had room with excellent view. Rooms are decorated in old style but nice and decent. As all hotels in Istanbul even this one is having thin walls, so you can hear everything. Breakfest is served on top floor with great view on sea and Sulhanamet area, breakfest selection is good. Be ready that you will be woken up by morning pray if you have window towards mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Gio F
Reviews.Content: i rated this 4 stars, basically for the great location this hotel has. If you ever visting istanbul on a short vacation, it is more than great. Many of the attractions (Blue mosque, topkapi palace, undeground cistene...) are a walking distance from you, and the Tram line is around 100 meters from the hotel. The hotel itself offers you just the basic necessities (Bed and Breakfast, Bathroom), although the room is not really filled with amenities but the WI-FI connection is very much appreciated. If your staying for a couple of days in Istanbul i highly recommend the Alzer

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL,STAFF, VALUE”
Reviews.Author: tana d
Reviews.Content: Great location,staff and value. Speical nods to Gokhan Akcay and Zubs who went over and above.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit...still great”
Reviews.Author: KazM287
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 10 years ago and was impressed then with the friendly service, adequate rooms and fabulous location. Had the pleasure of staying for a week in September and found everything as perfect as we remembered. Staff were as eager as ever to attend to our needs and helped make our holiday stay in Istanbul just perfect. Thoroughly recommend this boutique hotel for those looking for location, reasonable prices and genuine Turkish hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the sites”
Reviews.Author: Neha P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely as close to the Blue Mosque as it says it is! It is something else to be able to literally walk out of the hotel's front doors and step into the surrounding area of the mosque. The hotel is clean and the rooms are reasonable sizes. Buffet breakfast is served on the top floor with a breathtaking view. We stayed at this hotel during Ramadan and unknown to us, when we first booked, the area right in front of the hotel is the place to be! There were street vendors, food stalls and a fun, happy crowd. The hotel is walking distance to the tram, tour buses, some key sites and nice restaraunts. In general i found the staff to be nice but when we asked them for assistance we usually got recommended 'great' places to eat, tours to go on that also happened to be their friend's business etc. The places didn't always turn out to be that great. The staff also didn't want to help us with booking buses but were more than happy to give us the number of a travel agent who could. We ate at the hotel's restaraunt but found it a bit too pricey for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: r0lf54
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to major attractions such as the blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi. Facing a quiet street makes the location good for a sound sleep. Breakfast is served in a top floor restaurant with a stunning view. Our room was small but cozy. Always kept clean and tidy. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: WendyLou1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, clean, quiet with attentive staff and an overall friendly, welcome feeling. We had the best breakfasts and suppers with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia, right on the edge of theHhippadrome. Lovely......

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Location”
Reviews.Author: RS66
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location directly behind the Blue Mosque, the photos do not do it justice. Very friendly staff good quality rooms for the price and an astonishing view from the restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I'm stunned at the positive reviews. This place was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: hassan1
Reviews.Content: I've never had so much trouble writing a few paragraphs. One one hand, I trust trip advisor immensely and have used the site for years. However, no-one else seems to have had the SHOCKING stay that I had. I stayed at this hotel based on the positive reviews, and really regret that now, unfortunately. Look. It was amazing being so close to the Blue Mosque. Incredible. However, in 7 days, I visited the Mosque twice. You could spend a day at the mosque and never want to visit it again, so staying at Alzer for that reason, in my opinion, isn't the best one. Ok, I hate to talk badly about the hotel, because there are SOOO many positive reviews, so I'll make it brief. I back up everything i've said 100%. -ves I asked to move rooms twice, and both times they never got back to me. I stayed in room 33 (double room, facing street) Paper thin walls. Paper thin walls in bathroom..with ZERO extraction. The 'restaurant' (5th floor) food was terrible. I mean, it was SO poor. The same food was brought out 4 days in a row, before another poor attempt at breakfast meal was realised, the coffee is pathetic. A lavazza espresso cost Â£2.50. handrails and taps fell off (and were later fixed) there is a lot of construction work going on outside the hotel, and it seems the love to work twilight hours. +ves Air conditioning worked, tv worked, very clean, wifi worked, fridge worked, view is stunning,, staff are lovely but do like a good stare, the view of the blue mosque from the 5th floor makes a sweet facebook profile picture. This is what i told friends and family, and hopefully, this will help one of you: Don't stay here. If you're staying SOLELY in istanbul, for anything longer than 4 days, find a hotel nearer the bazaar or the egyptian spice market or right on the water. Staying at a hotel in Istanbul for its proximity to a monument is a misnomer- the city is VERY small and public transport is VERY good. Also, DO NOT GO TO HODGJA PASHA. Istanbul is an incredible place, I hope you enjoy your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - have already booked another stay there”
Reviews.Author: arcticboolie
Reviews.Content: Quaint Hotel rÄ±ght on the HÄ±ppodrome, wÄ±th vÄ±ews of the Blue Mosque, which is just across the street. The room was small (whÄ±ch is average inTurkey, so that's not really a drawback), but nicely decorated and clean, wÄ±th a large clean bathroom. The breakfast room, lÄ±ke many Ä±n Istanbul, was on the top floor wÄ±th beautiful views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. There was an excellent breakfast spread whÄ±ch I enjoyed every day. QuÄ±te a few more optÄ±ons than the regular Turkish breakfast. Staff were polÄ±te and helpful. There Ä±s Ä±nternet access and a nice cafe/ restautant Ä±n the hotel. The hotel's foyer also has the longest couch that Ä°'ve ever seen! Have already booked another stay here for later in the month. PrÄ±ces were very reasonable when booked online.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinarily convenient location & friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PattyandPhil
Reviews.Content: Everything you need and close to everything. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and knowledgeable, and good food, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Dsharman
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights. Very convenient location. Hotel room is clean and nice, of course a bit small, the bed actually had a real queen size mattress! Breakfast in the rooftop restaurant was good, with a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque. The desk staff were always helpful, spoke good English. The only downsides: at 4:30 am, being so close to the Blue Mosque for the call to prayer was not helpful in shaking jet-lag. We had a 'mosque view' room on floor 1, which gives a good view of the hippodrome. Unfortunately the hippodrome is not that interesting. And there was construction underway to repave this end of the hippodrome. Why they have to pour concrete at 3 am was a nightly mystery... The location is excellent, easy walking distance to the major sites. I would stay here again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: modesttraveller30s
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. The location could not be beat, right in front of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast was delicious and very filling as well. would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Charming Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TamimaT
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel was incredibly charming and in a great location! The room itself was very cute, clean and cozy, with a comfortable bed and excellent shower. Cons: The concierge wasn't very helpful in recommending sites to visit or directions on how to get to various places. They also did not have any maps to provide us with, which made navigating the city a bit more difficult than it should have been. Also, I brought my laptop given the free Wi-Fi in the building but the safe in the room was not big enough for my computer so I ended up having to carry it around all of Istanbul, which definitely put a strain on my shoulder(s) after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Traveler44Chicago
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of the Alzer is its location in the heart of Istanbul's main tourist attractions. It is on the square where the old hippodrome used to be, and right across the square is the Blue Mosque. Haya Sofia and the Topkapi Palace are within a 15-minute walk, and the cisterns within 5 minutes. A main street with a large number of restaurants is also very close. You can also easily walk to a tramline and take a tram across the Golden Horn to the newer part of Istanbul. Rooms are average--small by American standards, but quite adequate. There is a rooftop restaurant which provides a good breakfast and a great view of the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. A major plus--for those staying 3 or more days, the hotel arranges a pick-up at the airport. The only minus was that road in front of the hotel was dug up and quite muddy due to construction during our stay, but I expect that to be temporary. Overall, a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Photo Op Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaygodfrey
Reviews.Content: Alzer Hotel has one of the best locations I have experienced in my travels. The service was wonderful and the staff was very friendly and quite helpful. The breakfast included in the rate was exceptional and the restaurant where breakfast was served was unreal. You could eat your breakfast and view the Blue Mosque and the Haga Sophia. We enjoyed a beer each evening in this restaurant and watched the mosques as the sun set over Istanbul. The rooms were ncomfortable and the bathrooms were nice size.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl44
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alzer is a small, boutique hotel situated in the Hippodrome at Sultan Ahmet area of Istanbul. The rooms are small but adequate and the staff friendly & helpful. The restaurant terrace has amazing views of the Blue Mosque& Aya Sophia. A great location to access all the sights. On this visit it was unfortunate that there were road works in the Hippodrome so the outside eating area was out of use, but it will be improved and should be back in service soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location, pity about the roadworks.”
Reviews.Author: luccaLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel on 1st-6th October 2010. Booked because of its location ( perfect). Sadly upon arrival we found that the city council had decided to commence a major project of repaving the hippodrome area which is directly outside of the hotel. The entire frontage of the hotel was excavated to a depth of about 4ft, with construction machinery and materials obstructing access to the hotel. This is not a short term project, I would estimate that to complete the re-paving project will take a matter of months not weeks. My wife found ingress and exit to the hotel very difficult, stumbling over excavated paving,heavy machinery, and building materials ( photos available). At no point prior to our arrival did the hotel advise us of any anticipated dificulties. The location however was perfect, almost directly overlooking the Blue Mosque, the top floor restaurant with its panoramic windows allowed stunning views accross the hippodrome to Hagia Sofia and the Blue mosque. We had dinner there twice, and the food was very acceptable and reasonably priced, served by Zubo the restaurant manager, who was very polite and professional. If you can get to grips with the local transport system ( electric trams) its easy & cheap to get around, as are the ferries along the bosphorous. On balance I would avoid The Alzer until the contruction work has been completed, phone or Email them first to check on progress, as the pavement outside the hotel may have been completed when you plan to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Property in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BellevueHouse
Reviews.Content: The Alzer is in an ideal location for visiting the centre of the old city with good access to public transport, Grand Bazaar, all the historic sites and hammams. The pick up at the airport was perfect, the greeting and front desk service complete. We enjoyed our breakfasts in the roof top room to be beyond expectations (view and quality of food) and the for the dinner we enjoyed there the meal, service and views were outstanding also.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but pricy”
Reviews.Author: dkuhlman
Reviews.Content: The terrace room where breakfast is served attractive and has terrific views of the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast was excellent: there were quite a few more foods to choose from than other hotels we stayed at in Turkey. Our room was a bit small, but clean and pleasant. I believe that you can get a bigger, fancier room if you request it and if you pay more. There was a computer connected to the Internet in the lobby for guest use. And, all the staff that we talked with was very helpful and pleasant. There are plenty of things you will want to see within a short walk from the hotel. And, the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art is literally right next door. For me, it was definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and staff.”
Reviews.Author: PhilWragg
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes walk from The Blue Mosque, less than 10 from Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the underground Cistern this place's location cannot be bettered. Unprepossessing to look at, don't be fooled as it's like the Tardis inside with clean comfortable bedrooms with big beds and a top floor breakfast room with great views of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorous. Family run, lovely staff and good food as well. The road outside was being relaid when we were there and should be pedestrianised before end Oct which will make it a quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: grimmCypress_CA
Reviews.Content: Everything from picking us up at the airport, to the room, dinners, service and friendly attitude made us want to come back again. Gokhan, the office manager and Antik the restraunt manager, could not have made our visit more enjoyable. Thanks Guys! The breakfast was increadable. Everything exceeded our expectations. The location was fabulous as everything we wished to see was right out the front door! We feel like we became family over the few days spent here.

Reviews.Title: “A good central position”
Reviews.Author: SPJ2010
Reviews.Content: We thought this Hotel was in an excellent position, in walking distance to all the tourist sights. The rooms were very small and basic, but the rooftop breakfast room was a great way to look out over the hippodrome and surroundings. Do not be taken in by the photo gallery. We laughed and thought we must have being staying somewhere else! Free internet access was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jdandjm
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel in an old building in a great location. It overlooks the Hippodrome, mosques and the Bosphorus. Many shops and restaurants nearby. Not too far to the grand bazaar. Our room was reasonably large with most of the expected facilities. The bed was a little firm but comfortable. A/C quiet and effective. Bedside lamps bright enough for reading. The TV was a flat screen but the old analog format fed by satellite. All Turkish channels plus CNN. WiFi is free, but not always available at night. Very quiet at night. Our only problems with the room were no case racks, no desk for a computer and no instructions for anything. Also no ironing board.There is a nice dressing table that could be used as a desk, but there are no power points nearby. The ensuite is quite large but no bath. (Turkish or otherwise.) Would have liked more bench space at the wash stand and a few more clothes hooks. There is no exhaust fan. The hotel has a great roof top breakfast area with a fantastic view. (A good breakfast was included.) Downstairs at the entrance is also a bar/restaurant. We had one meal there and found it be very similar in standard and price to other nearby restaurants. All of the staff at this hotel have been very friendly and helpful. A final bonus: 12noon check out. Will always be happy to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull ,it met what i was looking for”
Reviews.Author: emcdz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel ,close to historical sites and very quiet by night ,where you can sleep well.Tidy and very clean . Stuff very nice and kindly I really liked it

Reviews.Title: “Tolles Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanrec
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very good location to visit the city. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast room was a little bit too hot during our stay in August. The naps could have been changed for following guests. The restaurant offers good specific Turkish menus. We recommend this hotel for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good service & great location”
Reviews.Author: bububazooka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alzer Hotel for one Saturday night in August when the Turkoman Hotel around the corner had mucked up with our reservation. The room was clean and well equipped although they didn't have a spare room with a view so I can't comment. However they have a lovely rooftop restaurant with amazing views of the Blue Mosque where we sat to have breakast before we headed off to catch our flight to Kars. The breakfast was fresh and tasty. It would have been lovely to sit in the rooftop restaurant to have a drink in the evening but it wasn't open. However they also have a cafe at ground level so you can soak up the atmosphere from the street side. The staff were extremely helpful and informed. We asked them to book a restaurant for us in the evening that we'd been to before and they knew the restaurant would send us a complimentary taxi so booked that too. They even called the breakfast room to inform us our taxi had arrived in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - the REAL Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: artfirenze
Reviews.Content: While many of the luxury chain hotels are situated on Taksim Square this is quite a way from the action as they are in the business district so you could be anywhere as you are surrounded by glass and chrome. The Alzer, on the other hand, is situated right in the heart of the city and is directly opposite the Blue Mosque so you only have to cross the road to get to the gem. This is the real Istanbul, 2 mins from Hagia Sophia, 10 mins walk from the Grand Bazaar and at the end of one of the main street with literally hundreds of restaurants so if you want to experience the city then this is an ideal place to stay. It only has 20 odd rooms so is small and very friendly with excellent staff. Buffet breakfast is served in the rooftop restaurant with stunning views (see pic). We stayed here following a recommendation from a friend and it lived up to her comments. We were also lucky to be in Istanbul for the start of Ramadan so it is a great experience to mix with the locals as the square outside come alive at dusk with picnics and food sellers for the end of the days fasting. You soon get used to the loud calls to prayers from the Blue Mosque too - all adds to the authentic experience rather than the more sterile chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - wonderfully helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KentTwizzle
Reviews.Content: I chose the Alzer Hotel for its location, and was certainly not disappointed - you can practically touch the Blue Mosque from here. All of the most important sights of Istanbul were within a five minute walk. Arriving at the Airport, there was a driver with my name on a board (courtesy of the hotel) and I had a lovely welcome dinner on my first night. The view from the breakfast room on the roof of the hotel is stunning, and the cafe/restaurant at the front of the hotel looking out on the Hippodrome is a very relaxing place for a drink or a meal. I would recommend paying extra for a Hippodrome Room. The room was quite spacious and beautifully decorated. I had a lot of luggage with me, as I was spending 5 days here before embarking on a three week cruise, so storage space was a bit of an issue for me, but would be fine if you were just there for, say, up to a week. Other people have mentioned the call to the prayer in the early hours of the morning which, of course, is quite loud given the proximity to the Blue Mosque. By the third night I actually slept though it! The biggest plus point of this hotel is its staff, especially for the solo traveller. The atmosphere is very welcoming and friendly, and you really feel that you are coming home when you return at the end of a hot day of sightseeing. The star has to be the wonderful Gokhan (Front Office Manager), who speaks excellent English and sorts anything and everything that you need. On the day I was leaving to embark the cruise ship, I was a little worried about just getting an ordinary taxi as I had never been to the Istanbul Harbour before, didn't know how many ships would be in, and how far I might have to carry my luggage etc. Anyway, after some discussion with his colleagues, Gokhan arranged that the man who met me at the airport would take me to the harbour, and I was also accompanied by Mevlut (one of the chefs who was off duty) in case I needed someone to carry my bags! How lovely was that! I would definitely stay here again when visiting Istanbul - the location is unbeatable and so are the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff at Best Location”
Reviews.Author: AndreForrestHill
Reviews.Content: We came from New Zealand to this Hotel to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. Why you may ask. Well we stayed here in 2005 and were so impressed by the location right on the Hippodrome and the service of a waiter named Mehmet that we decided to return. Mehmet was still there and as courteous as ever, shouting us a beer and a wine the minute we arrived and making us feel right at home. What a man with a great memory. The breakfast was great & plenty of it and the lady in charge (we lost her name) was most helpful & friendly. Engin was the evening barman & restaurant manager and a more happy, helpful chap you would be lucky to meet. The overall Manager was Gokhan Akcay who was full of knowledge, visit suggestions and very helpful overall. We observed him going to exceptional lenghts to aid an elderly USA couple whose luggage had been lost by an airline. After numerous phone calls he located it, then ran the couple to the airport to recover their cases & then sped back to the port in his car and got them on their Cruise ship minutes before it sailed. Brilliant work and all the staff display this type of attitude. They are a really pleasant team working at a hotel in the very best of locations in Sultanamet, the historical part of Istanbul. It is only minutes to all the wonderful sights such as the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Yerebatan Sarayi (underground cisterns) Archaeological Museum, Grand Bazaar etc. and the Bosphorus. We lacked no amenities and for a National Historic Trust building it is kept in good order, clean & comfortable. Just the spot for any sightseeing tourist and quite reasonable pricewise. We will be back even if its just shake hands with Mehmet again.

Reviews.Title: “Pasha Suite provides an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: TGtraveler53
Reviews.Content: The Alzer Hotel is ideally located across the street from the Hippodrome which is across from the Blue Mosque. With solid walls of windows on three sides of the living room, the Pasha Suite affords an amazing view of the Blue Mosque. I shared the expense of the room with two friends. The rooms were nicely decorated, the bathroom well equipped and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. But it was the jaw dropping view that made the room so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tinys
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location. Right on the Hippodrome overlooking the Blue Mosque, next door to the Islamic museum and opposite the obelisk. The tram stop is really only a 5 minute walk away and we took the tram/metro to the airport for just 3 lira. Taxi airport to hotel cost us 35 lira. We arrived at 5am and the staff allowed us to check into our room which was a big plus considering usually check in is at 12 and many hotels charge extra for this but the Alzer didnâ€™t. Room and hotel were clean, decor not to all tastes, floral and a bit chintzy. The room was small but had everything you would need including mini fridge and safe, plenty of hot water for showering. Breakfast served in roof top restaurant between 7 and 10am with great view over the square. Breakfast was a buffet style and only disappointment was mostly cold food and a bit repetitive. The staff were really helpful and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. There was a ground floor restaurant, free WIFI or use of a laptop if you donâ€™t bring your own. We will be returning to Istanbul later this year and iâ€™ll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and breakfast in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AraratIsOurs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in countless hotels all over the world and while there was nothing above average about the rooms and overall state of the Alzer hotel, what stands out for me is the amazing proximity to the beauty of the Blue Mosque from the room window and also the breathtaking views from the rooftop breakfast room. The location is perfect-- you feel youself in the center of Istanbul as you step out-- literally into the hippodrome. Also, if you are like me and appreciate a good breakfast, this is the place to stay. Whereas most hotels of this class offer you tea, jam, white cheese and a few olives, Alzer had an elaborate breakfast buffet with a variety of cold and hot prepred dishes which altered almost every day. I also loved the yogurt accompanied by an assortment of dried fruit and nuts which you can prepare as you choose and mix with honey. Real filter coffee and wonderful black tea. It was a pleasure waking up and starting the day... Christine

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff!!! So friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: RangerBert
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival our flight was late and getting through customs slow. Over an hour late. The hotel still had a person and driver waiting for us to deliver us to the hotel. I arrived with a broken arm on Easter Sunday in the evening and the staff arranged a taxi to a private hospital. Each evening and morning the staff greeted us warmly and with sincerity. All of the staff were extremely helpful making you feel welcomed in the evening after a day in the city. The staff made it pleasant and the V..I..E..W from breakfast!!!! wow. Room was serviceable and very quiet. :) Thank you to the staff! Loved our stay in Istanbul and we will use you again when we return. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good place and very nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist2310
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at a very good place from where you can reach nearly all places like, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque or Topkapi Palace, etc. The Hotel personal are very friendly and can help you in any problems. For any questions you can contact Mr. GÃ¶khan Akcay (Front Office Manager), because he can give you very good suggestions and will try to find an answer to your question not only regarding the Hotel, but also about shopping, to rent a car or taxi, etc. We will try to use these Hotel for our next visit in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “At the hearth of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AAyse
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night but will definitely stay again. clean, good value for money and excellent breakfast in the teras looking over the blue mosque and the Marmara sea. what else we could have asked for! Ayse+Alkan

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: alexismonemvasia
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice, sure i recommend with no doubts. I hope to be again in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely stuff”
Reviews.Author: naty_mv18
Reviews.Content: the stuff is great, very friendly and very helpful, they were always willing to help us. the location was perfect, the hotel is right in front of the blue mosque and really close to St sophia. It is a really GOOD CHOICE to stay in Alzer Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Alzer Hotel - a hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Stennie53
Reviews.Content: The Alzer Hotel is a hidden treasure in the bustling streets of the historical part of Istanbul - Sultanamet and situated opposite the Blue Mosque. The Alzer is a boutique type Hotel with well appointed clean rooms (serviced daily) with an en suite bathroom. Breakfast, included in the package, was a typical Turkish fare more than adequate for our needs and was taken on the top floor with fabulous views of the Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea. The staff, particulary Engin and Gokhan, were extremely helpful - pointing out good deals, assisting with tours and generally adding value to our stay. I hope the owner values their contribution to the hotel's ambience! We would not hesitate to recommend the Alzer Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will, hopefully return for another visit one day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: CollieDog15
Reviews.Content: A bit late in writing this, but we were on 4/5 month trip, 6 weeks in Turkey. Recommended to us by an elderly Istanbuli we met elsewhere, the Alzer Hotel was a real find. Our room was at the back, but a good size, very clean and the bathroom was spacious and immaculate. The breakfast buffet at the top of the hotel gave a spendid view, the food was good and varied and fed you more than enough for the day. All the staff were helpful and friendly, especially Engin whose excellent English compensated for our lousy Turkish. We arrived with no reservations saying we would stay a few nights and the management were so helpful when we had to move nearby after 6 nights as all the rooms were pre booked. We had several dinners at the hotel and again food and service were great. The location of course is so central and even in July the numbers of tourists did not completely spoil the atmosphere. Sitting in the restaurant at night, watching lights on the Blue Mosque minarets and and birds circling. Magic.

Reviews.Title: “This is the spot. If you want to see Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JTamson
Reviews.Content: You cannot get any more central than this, step outside and you are at the Blue Mosque. All the main sites of intrest are within one square mile. right on your doorstep. The views from the breakfast room are stunning. The manager Gokan Akcay is very informative and helpfull and allways had time to ask what you seen or done. I will return to this gem

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great choice for location and comfort with great value for money”
Reviews.Author: EnglandClarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in November. The best feature of the hotel is the location, which is quiet but central. The room was very comfortable and a good size. The breakfast was varied, good quality with plenty of choice. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a boutique hotel at the heart of Sulatanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Bobi27
Reviews.Content: Alzer Hotel is a gem of a boutique hotel -- reasonably priced, fantastically situated near Istanbul's must-see sites, and professionally- run. Most of all, Gokhan and Engin -- the two staff you'd see oftren at the htoel -- are sincerely frieindly and helpful. Engin's particulalry dedeiated to his job -- I and my wife had lots of laughs when we saw him brave a torrential rain late one evening to buy bread at a nearby supermakret, which had run out for his guests. One thing they should do though is to change the hotel's location map, which is confusing for taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “This is a first class place!”
Reviews.Author: helencole78
Reviews.Content: With all the hotels available in Istanbul you may worry if you have picked a rotton one. This Hotel is everything you want from a Boutique Hotel. The rooms are beautifully decorated and furnished. and altogether very comfortable. We had a lovely view of the main square in front of the Blue Mosque. It was suprisingly quiet with the windows closed and only the call to prayers in the morning will wake you but that is all part of the experience. The staff are polite and professional without being overbearing which I liked and they made our stay everything I could hope for so a big thankyou. I would recommend this place to anyone its first class.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good and convenient for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: jjuliette
Reviews.Content: We had a brief layover in Istanbul, from 7am until noon and decided to book a hotel so we would at least have a base for those few hours. It wasn't cheap but we felt it was necessary. We weren't in it much. Our room was spacious, had a great view, and was well decorated. There was some confusion with pick up from the airport both in terms of availability and PRICE. The hotel is quaint, very clean and includes a lovely buffet breakfast on an upper floor with a fantastic view. Male front desk staff on duty were very accomodating and helpful. Hopefully we can return here one day for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...Location...”
Reviews.Author: mohmohsin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alzer was a mixed experience. What the hotel lacks in room quality it for sure makes up in location. Situated right across from the Sultanahmet mosque and the Hippodrome, almost all sights are within a five minute walk. The area also has a lot of restaurants with excellent quality Turkish food and there are also numerous bars. Their staff is very knowledgeable and courteous. I was even warned the first day not to talk to strangers on the street, which by the way saved me from a lot of monetary loss. The rooms are ok, nothing to brag about, but not bad either. At night though it tends to get very noisy and I had trouble sleeping even with the windows closed. Itâ€™s difficult to fault the hotel for this since the whole area is full of late night revelers, stray dogs and shrieking sea gulls. Perhaps the best experience came with talking to Engin, a waiter at night time, who was very knowledgeable and fun to talk to over Turkish tea. Overall I would rate this hotel as an excellent choice based on location, staff and the overall Istanbul experience.

Reviews.Title: “Alzer Pasha Suite is a very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SkiAlta22
Reviews.Content: The Alzer is a great location by the Egyptian Obilisk in front of the Blue Mosque.they have very friendly service and were very helpful with our every need and question. convenient and simple breakfest. Front Office manager Gokhan Akcay was very help ful. The Pasha Suite worked very well for my family(wife and 2 children)!

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Alzer Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hclj
Reviews.Content: The location and views were excellent and the room and breakfast exceeded our expectations. The room was spacious and clean and the breakfast offered good variety. The staff was helpful and everything was as agreed upon in terms of price, airport transfers, etc. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaChernova
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, with very good service, located literally facing the blue mosque. Amazing view of the historic center. Unforgettable view. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravel59
Reviews.Content: The location is as good as it could possibly be for touring Istanbul. Bassilica Cistern, Haggia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, train stops are all a very short walk from the front door of the hotel. Beware that speakers across the street for "call to prayer" come with this location, so a room facing the hippodrome will offer great atmosphere that includes sound. We found it charming...others might not. The staff is some of the best I have ever enjoyed at any hotel, including 5-stars. The breakfast is not to be missed. We were upgraded our first night to the honeymoon suite in honor of our 25 anniversary. What a pleasant surprise! The views from that room as well as the breakfast room are superb. The cleanliness, attention to detail, and top-notch staff attest to some very good hotel management behind the Alzer.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay at Hotel Alzer again!”
Reviews.Author: crystalmas
Reviews.Content: It was exactly as advertised on the internet. The breakfast room has lovely views. Service was excellent...they were able to answer all of our questions and yet were not overly helpful that it became annoying. Location is perfect, not toooo touristy and yet not remote. It was a safe, clean area that was just a hop, skip and a jump away from all major attractions. My only minor complaint is that the beds are quite firm, but thats more of a personal preference. I will certainly stay there again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sigrutten
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an excellent location and very friendly staff. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful historical hotel with great staff and delicious food.”
Reviews.Author: Tulay_9
Reviews.Content: My family and I were 6, so we booked 2 rooms where I shared one room with 2 daughters and my husband with our two sons. Rooms are decorated nicely and very clean. My room had beautiful view of the Hippadrome Square and monument. The staff is friendly and helpful and they served a delicious breakfast every morning from a terrace with magnificent views. We travelled on foot to most of the historical attractions, and the streets are safe and filled with other tourists. There are loads of nearby restaurants and shopping and I would definately stay at the Alzer again if ever we return to Sultanahmet,Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SFO-tourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2009, and it was simply a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (especially Engin)! You cannot get a better location -- opposite the Blue Mosque in the Hippodrome - walk to the tram station, Hagya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, etc. The breakfast was served on the rooftop, with great views!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieLozza1985
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely stay and had great customer service.. the breakfast was great and had a fantastic view. The room was fine but the price of stay was a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We would not go anywhere else when in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: alexander47
Reviews.Content: This hotel,though small, is in the centre of old Istanbul(Sultanahmet) and is near all the attractions as well as the tram which takes you to the airport metro. The staff are so friendly and helpful and as there is very little turnover,they recognize us each time we go. The rooms are small but they have TV, ensuite,and safes and there is a lift to the fifth floor where there is a short stairs to the roof terrace cafe with wonderful views of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location perfect.”
Reviews.Author: berurier
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location, in the Hippodrome. Just in the middle of the main sites. I was afraid that it could be noisy because Hippodrom is often crowdy place. But in fact inside the rooms you are not disturbed at all. The rooms are not very big but very nice and very clean. The barthroom is quite big and clean with a big shower. Staff is very polite and kind and speaks enough english to answer main questions. From the breakfast terrace, you have an impressine view on the hippodrome and Blue mosk which you could nearly touch ! The price we got at this moment was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very nice people.”
Reviews.Author: ramesh09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alzer hotel for about 5 days in June. Its a really nice, small hotel with a fantastic location - on At Meydani, the former Hippodrome, just across from the Blue Mosque. On the first night we were given room 32 - which was really small and cramped - and we were not too happy. The next morning we requested a room change and they moved us to room 34 - the `Standart Room' on their website - which was quite nice and comfortable. It was a lot larger and brighter than the earlier room - though the view from the room was unremarkable. What is fantastic is the view from the breakfast room. You have a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia on one side and the sea of Marmara on the other. What really made the stay memorable though were the people. Engin, the person who runs the restaurant/bar in the evenings is a really wonderful man. We quite enjoyed chatting with him in the nights after returning from an evening of sight seeing. On learning that we did not have a guide book he lent us an excellent guidebook which had been left to him by a previous guest. He also had several recommendations of places to eat and shop - and it was clear these were genuine recommendations and he was not working on commision. The breakfast was extremely good and one of the things I really miss. The cook, Mevlut, makes an excellent form of scrambled eggs. There were all kinds of things to suite every palate - from meat things to fresh crispy cereal to healthy fruits. The receptionist, Gokhan, was also a very friendly guy and was responsible for moving us to the nicer room which completely changed our perspective of the place. From speaking with the staff we got the impression that they feel like a big happy family and enjoy their jobs - which shows in the way they treat people.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: almostgramma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best possible location for an Istanbul trip. We had a triple room which was large enough for the beds and decent walking around room. While not a "luxury hotel" It has everyhting you need! The evelvator stops at the 5th floor and you walk some steps to the breakfast room. Be sure to take your camera to breakfast! The view is amazing. The staff were very friendly...especially at breakfast, like having a friend greet you in the morning...sure to start your day right! The only down side is the noise from the car-park right outside our window ( no, we didnt have a view room) We were on the first floor and the bathroom had a kindof fishy smell.. which may have been coming from the kitchen venting..we closed the vent in the bathroom and it was much better. It certainly wasnt enough to complain about. Overall a good room, a fantastic location and a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “very good value hotel,in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KirkyBedford
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Cafer and Engin. The breakfasts were inclusive and with plenty of variety to choose. Our bedroom overlooked the Blue Mosque, which added to the hotels appeal. Definitely recommende for travellers on an average budget for the holiday

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: mtrommer
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent, lying directly across from the Blue Mosque. The staff is comprised by about 7 people who do everything: from the front desk to the restaurant and terrace to transport to and from the airport. They are always friendly and very helpful. The double rooms are relatively small, while our triple room was quite spacious. The hotel itself was relatively no-frills and not necessarily quite as elegant as the photos suggest. However, we have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LeticiaR
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It is located in front of the hippodrome, very very close to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Cisterns. The staff very friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the breakfast delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AdrinaSingapore
Reviews.Content: The Alzer with its superb location is within walking distance to some of the most important cultural and religious sites in Sultanahmet, Istanbul. The room (single) at the hotel is a little small but comfortable nonetheless and very clean. The spread at breakfast is pretty satisfying and is served on the top floor which has magnificient / breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia as well as the Sea of Marmara. The staff at Alzer is exceptionally warm, kind and friendly. Special thanks and compliments to Cafer (who speaks fluent English) for his excellent service at breakfast and also the rest of the staff for having made my stay at the Alzer a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location & Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: michaeloxfordU_K_
Reviews.Content: The Alzer must be built on the foundations of the seating of the ancient Hippodrome & faces the site of the Imperial Palace (now the Blue Mosque) where the chariot races so beloved of the Romans & Byzantines took place. It is a superb location within walking distance of Aggia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace, Justinian's Cistern, & the Blue Mosque. This small, comfortable & friendly family hotel has a restaurant on the top floor where breakfast is served which has an incomparable view across the Hippodrome towards the Sea of Marmara & where breakfast is served with panache by the friendly English-speaking Cafer (pronounced "Shafair"). The rooms (especially the more expensive front ones) look over the Hippodrome & are luxurious. I have been coming here for some years (about 5 visits) & will continue to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alzer - very good value”
Reviews.Author: mikulin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alzer has a fantastic location, directly opposite the blue mosque and three minuutes walk from Hagia Sophia. It couldn't be better positioned. The rooms are spacious and fully equipped and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a restaurant with views over the blue mosque and the Bosphorus and offers room service, cable tv, and wired internet access. It isn't the most luxurious hotel in the world, but for the price it's excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location!”
Reviews.Author: singalong100
Reviews.Content: If anyone wants to do Istanbul in four days and no hassle then Alzer Hotel is the perfect location. The triple room had a terrible view but the room itslef was quite pretty and the lack of view was made up by the breakfast room. Such a treat to see it all from the top. The breakfast was pretty good too! A word of caution. Please make sure when you order a taxi through the hotel that it is a fully licensed taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel -Great Staff-Superb Loation”
Reviews.Author: jaguarWalsall
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in great location.Extremely helpful staff.Excellent breakfast.Special mention to Cafer who served at breakfast each day and looked after us superbly.

Reviews.Title: “christmas on the bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: simonettairlanda
Reviews.Content: Mary and I spent Christmas in the Alzer Hotel in Istanbul. The staff had a lovely Christmas token for all guests.They had a special breakfast for us on Christmas day, they organized our cruise and they looked after us beautifully. We had great evenings chatting to them and others guests about politics and economics. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alzer for six nights over the Christmas holiday. We arranged for pick-up with the hotel and the driver was there waiting for us when we arrived and was very courteous. The check-in process was efficient and all of the hotel staff were very pleasant and professional. We reserved a Hippodrome room and felt that it was well worth the extra money because the room was considerably larger than some of the other rooms we saw, and we also had a great view of the Blue Mosque. Our room was clean with a mini fridge and plenty of storage but no tea/coffee maker. The window area of our room was very drafty but the room itself was warm enough despite the very cold temperature outside so it wasn't a problem. There were several channels on the flat screen TV that included CNN and BBC. The breakfast had a nice variety. Although be warned, if you arrive toward the end of service you're pretty much stuck with whatever is left. They didn't replenish the eggs and potatoes. Prior to arriving at the hotel I did experience slowness in receiving email responses from the hotel. After we arrived I attributed that to the extremely slow and spotty internet connection. At times the WIFI was fine, other times it was so painfully slow that we gave up. Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially if you get a good rate, and prepare yourself for a small room if you're not able to secure one of the Hippodrome rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Alzer”
Reviews.Author: Chandvi
Reviews.Content: I chose the Alzer hotel because it was so close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. I was suppose to stay at the Alzer 3 days then move on to another hotel. I decided to stay at the Alzer, because the hotel staff went above and beyond to make sure my husband and I were comfortable. The staff were quite friendly and offered good advice on places to eat, things to do and on a variety of tours to go on. The rooms were nice and clean everyday. The Breakfast was excellent! I was by far very please that I chose to spend my week during the Chrismas Holiday at the Alzer. I would like to say thank you to Gorkhan and Engin for all that they have done for us to make sure we had a good time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch Experts”
Reviews.Author: gfogal
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation weeks ahead of time, plus we followed up multiple times after that to insure there would be no problems. Each time we were told everything was fine. But when we arrived we were shocked to be told the hotel was full, and would we like to stay at another hotel (of lesser quality)?!? Since it was late at night my wife went ballistic. After reading the manager the riot act he magically produced two nice rooms. Bottom line: Be wary of Istanbul hotels that give away your room especially if it was a good rate. Some hotels (and/or staff) front for other (cheaper) hotels in the area, and when you arrive late at night you are easy prey to this tactic. You'll find similar comments from other hotels in the area, so stick to your guns and demand your room. Note: We've stayed at the Tria Hotel and never had this problem

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aalanis
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i booked in to the Alzer hotel for a week. it was in a great location and the staff were very,polite, friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The hotel was close to all the attractions e.g blue mosque, grand bazaar, aya Sophia and topkapi palace. it was convenient because we could go back to the hotel for a break and then head out again. The only disappointing things were the food served at the restaurant and the fact that they did not have proper satalite/cable television in their rooms like mentioned on the website, neither did they have the pay per view movies. Also Tea and coffee facilities seem to be available only in certain rooms which was not mentioned and the rooms are very small but comfortable nonetheless. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel because of the friendly staff and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Ottoman styled room with great views”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Alzer Hotel in Istanbul when another nearby hotel which I was supposed to stay at was overbooked. I was pleasantly surprised and had no regrets. The room was furnished in Ottoman style with a ceiling chandelier. Even the telephone in the room was the old-fashioned rotary dialling type. There was a good view of the Blue Mosque. The bathroom was well equipped with toileteries and hair dryer. There was free internet access from a laptop computer in the lobby. If you do not mind the early morning call to worship at 6 am, the Alzer Hotel is most ideal for the tourist as it is right in the old town of Sultahahmet where the major attractions like the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace are located.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Alzer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlgeeWallington
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day stay in Istanbul after a cruise around the coast of Turkey. I had booked a Hippodrome room, but on arrival was told that they were fully booked and so we were upgraded to the Pasha Suite! Fabulous room with separate sitting room, plasma TV, whirlpool bath. Having settled in very nicely and wondering what we had done to warrant such good fortune, after breakfast the next day we were told that we were to move to the Hippodrome room. We were disappointed, but our bags were moved for us whilst we were out and on our return found that the Hippodrome room was pretty good too. Great position right opposite the Blue Mosque and just down from The Hagia Sophia. We enjoyed watching the goings on in the square below as the families came out to play in the evenings before going to prayer. Noise was not a problem, in fact we were suprised at how quiet it was both late at night and in the mornings. Breakfast of fresh and dried fruit, cereals, eggs, cheese, honey still in the comb, on the roof terrace whilst looking out at the Blue Mosque was wonderful. Staff were helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Manatee609
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul was for the wedding of our close Austrian friends' son and a beautiful Turkish girl. The bride and groom chose the Alzer Hotel for some guests while younger ones stayed in a hotel with no air conditioning - an iffy choice in August. We were more than delighted with the Alzer. The location is unbelievable - truly across the small park to the Blue Mosque and within walking distance to the most important sites. We stayed in two rooms, having upgraded to the Pasha suite upon arriving and when it was no longer available, a more standard room. Both were very satisfactory and had charm and a sense of authentic culture. The staff was outstanding - meeting and surpassing every expectation. Although we had a fairy tale trip, going to the lavish wedding which had over 500 guests, and meeting many lovely people in their private homes, the Alzer contributed greatly to this visit to one of the world's most wonderful destinations.

Reviews.Title: “M. Pourbayat,s Experiences from Alzer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pourbayat
Reviews.Content: Norway M. Pourbayat My experience from Alzer Hotel is form may 2008. Alzar is a small hotel with international standard with a friendly atmosphere. I have been tour manager for a group of academics and professionals who have been interested in Turkish culture and Istanbul. I have received only positive feedback from tour members. I have many experiences from several hotels in Istanbul but my experience as a tour manager from Azar Hotel was very positive. Alzar Hotel, located in the historic part of Istanbul, and only a few metres from the Blue mosque in Sultanhamet. This location is unique. At the same time, there are not too much traffic noise around the hotell and it's not far from the city's most valuable historical and cultural places. By staying at the Azar hotell saved us a lot of time by not using taxi or bus. The hotel has a politely and kind staff. The food is very good and safe. The hotel has a very rich and good breakfast with well-behaved kitchen - personnel. The rooms are large enough, clean and inventories are very nice and have a high quality. Bathrooms are large, modern and clean. The hotel has a very skilled manager that she could assist with information and assistance already in the planning phase and before we left for IStanbul. The price is not high in relation to quality. The room walls are not insulated against the noise, but they are not so noisy even the hotel is located in middle of a mega city. I'm going to use the same hotel for my groups in the future, and can safely recommend to other agencies, and tourists who want quality in relation to the price they pay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust them!”
Reviews.Author: LesTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location, OK facilities, but VERY questionable business ethics. We PRE-PAID our reservations through our travel agent-- two days at the beginning of our trip and two days at the end. First two days were fine...but upon our return, we were informed that a "small problem" existed and the hotel gave away our reservations to another group. They proposed to move us into another hotel for one night and then force us to pack up and move back to the Alzer the second night. Packing up after one night and then shifting over to the Alzer would be a nightmare, so I proposed that we spend both nights at the other hotel and was told they were booked up the second night. After checking into the other hotel, I asked about availability for the second night and sure enough, they had space....so...the Alzer lied. I asked the other hotel to call over and see if we can stay the second night and their reply was "no, that wasn't good for the Alzer." I then walked over to the Alzer and they FINALLY recanted and we stayed put. So, would I recommend the Alzer again...no way...they really don't care about their customers even when the PRE-PAY for a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tekier
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic holiday in Istanbul and Hotel Alzer offered Turkish hospitality at its best! From the moment of arrival we were shown to our room and was given some information about the location we were staying in and recommendations for tours/restaurants. The hotel and room were very clean and staff were very friendly making sure that we were happy at all times. Breakfast was served on the 5th floor and offered fantastic views of Sultan Ahmet mosque and St Sophia. The staff present at breakfast was a lovely man who made sure that eveyone was happy and was happy to accommodate any special requests. I would throughly recommend staying at this hotel especially due to its close location to all the historical sites. The only word of advice would be around the taxi drivers. We only had one bad experience when we were charged a night rate when using the taxi in the morning. Between the hours of 6am-12 midnight make sure that the meter shows 'gunduz' starting rate of 2.00 TL. any hours after that the taxi's double the rate. Better still its always recommended to ask the hotel staff to call you a taxi!! Take the Bosphoras tour from Eminonu harbour over to Anadolu Kavagi (asian side) and make sure you sample the fresh fish and take a walk up to Yoros Castle for wonderful views. Also highly recommended is the sufi music concert and whirling dervishes ceremony held at Sirkeci station - follow the tram line and its about a 15 minute walk. Lastly, whilst the Han restaurant which is very near Topkapi Palace looks very good we would advise that you avoid eating here as the staff are extremely rude and the food is better almost everywhere else! Try the Rumeli cafe highly recommended for its food and service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBern
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Alzer in March with my Father and arrived fairly late and tired. I was not best pleased on arrival to find that they didn't have the room reservations we had asked for - one twin room. Instead they tried to offer us an alternative room in a different hotel! We declinded this. They then took us to "our room" which turned out to be a room with a double bed in it! They then presented us with an additional single bed that pulled out from the base of the double, therefore creating less space in the room. We had to wait whilst they made up the beds. The room hardly had any hangers in the wardrobe and the safe didn't work for two days. Having complained about all of the above the rooms and hotel was very clean, the help yourself buffet breakfast was lovey and the staff courteous. The location was fantastic and the main attractions were either a quick walk away or via the nearby tram. In the end we were satisfied with our stay and the manager did agree to reduce the rate we had booked via email of 99 Euros to 85 Euros which was quite a large reduction.

Reviews.Title: “What a view !”
Reviews.Author: Agripina
Reviews.Content: On our way to Bangkok we planned to stop for one night (from 01/01 to 01/02/2008) in Istanbul. We had never been there before and simply needed a decent room in a prime location in Sultanahmet area and a late check-out, because our flight to BKK was at 11.00 p.m. â€œAlzerâ€� hotel was one of the first, which offered us a room for reasonable money (139 Euros +50 euros for late check-out). After arriving in â€œAlzerâ€� we were pleasantly shocked â€“ its location (like everybody says here in this case) can not be beaten. We were straight on Hippodrome, right in front of us â€“ two obelisks, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia with Marmara Sea on a background. The hotel itself was simple, small but nice and clean. The first room we were taken to looked like a closet with no view and we immediately asked for something â€œbigger with a nicer viewâ€�. The receptionist was absolutely cooperative (as though he expected this kind of a reaction from us). Finally we got a Pasha Suite â€“ nicely decorated suite with long corridor, small bedroom and vast sitting-room with absolutely stunning view. This view from Pasha Suite is worth another trip to Istanbul and weâ€™ll stay there without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DODAF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alzer Hotel from December 27, 2007 to January 3, 2008. It is ideally located in the Sultanahmet, directly across from the Blue Mosque on the Hippodrome. It was an easy walk to many of the other sites such as the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The tram was close by to get to other parts of the city. It was also within easy walking distance of the Eminonu harbour, the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar. The hotel is a 6-story heritage building, consisting of about 20 rooms, 2 dining rooms, a small lounge in the reception area, and an elevator. Our room was small but pleasantly furnished with a queen size bed, 2 bedside tables, a small wardrobe, desk, bar fridge, and an attractive 3-piece bathroom with shower. The housekeeping was superb; everything in the hotel was clean and shiny. Breakfast was included in the price and was served in the 6th floor dining room overlooking the Marmara Sea, the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, and Hagia Sophia. The food was delicious due to an excellent chef. The staff was friendly, helpful, and always courteous. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we return to Istanbul. D&D Canada

HotelInfo.Address: At MeydanI No:72 Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122-1, Turkey
